That's a great plan! Watching videos, reading articles, and practicing in front of a mirror will definitely help you learn proper form and technique. And if you're still unsure, consulting with a personal trainer or fitness professional is a great idea. They can provide personalized feedback and guidance to help you improve your form and technique.

Remember, proper form and technique are crucial to getting the most out of your workouts and preventing injuries. It's always better to take the time to learn and practice proper form than to risk injury or ineffective workouts.

Additionally, don't be afraid to start slow and progress gradually. It's okay to start with lighter weights and higher reps, and gradually increase the weight and intensity as you become more comfortable with the exercises.

Lastly, remember to listen to your body and take rest days as needed. It's important to allow your muscles time to recover and rebuild, especially when you're starting a new exercise routine.

You got this! You're taking the first steps towards a healthier and stronger you. Keep me updated on your progress, and don't hesitate to reach out if you have any more questions or need further guidance.
